meanings.sent1: Some blockheads refuse to listen to good advice.
meanings.sent2: Don't be a blockhead and ignore the warning signs.
meanings.sent3: The blockheads in the comedy show always make silly mistakes.
meanings.sent4: His stubbornness turned him into a real blockhead.
meanings.sent5: The teacher tried hard to help the blockheads understand the lesson.

meanings.definition: A wooden block used for shaping or stamping.
meanings.sent1: The carpenter used a blockhead to create a perfect corner.
meanings.sent2: The artist pressed the blockhead onto the clay to make a pattern.
meanings.sent3: The blockhead left a clear mark on the paper when pressed firmly.
meanings.sent4: The blockhead served as a reliable tool for the sculptor.
meanings.sent5: The blockhead's edges were smooth and ideal for shaping the clay.
